HI

NMFibreWalk.NMFibreWalk ‚Äî Module

An implementation of the non-markovian quantum walk in k-space with a discrete bath

source
NMFibreWalk.Diagonalization ‚Äî Type
Diagonalization(H)
Diagonalization(k, params)

The result of diagonalizing the system hamiltonian.

source
NMFibreWalk.ExtendedModelParameters ‚Äî Type
ExtendedModelParameters([keyword args])

The parameters required to simulate the model, agnostic of how they are arrived at. Instead of specifying the bath spectrum and coupling directly, these values are computed later on.

  • v::Float64: Intracell hopping.

  • u::Float64: Ratio of inter to intracell hopping.

  • spectral_density::OhmicSpectralDensity: The spectral density to use for the bath.

  • N::Int64: The number of bath modes.

  • discretization::BathDiscretization: The bath discretization method to use. See BathDiscretization.

  • normalize::Bool: Whether to normalize the spectra density. See discretize_bath.

  • sw_approximation::Bool: Whether the system should simulated in the Schrieffer-Wolff approximation.

  • œâ_A::Float64: The energy of the $A$ site.

  • Œ∑0::Float64: The damping rate of the small loop.

  • Œ∑0_bath::Float64: The damping rate of the big loop.

  • Œ∑_coup::Float64: The damping rate due to the transmission line attached to the small loop.

  • Œ¥::Float64: The hybridization amplitude.

source
NMFibreWalk.ModelParameters ‚Äî Type

The parameters required to simulate the model, agnostic of how they are arrived at.

  • v::Float64: Intracell hopping.

  • u::Float64: Ratio of inter to intracell hopping.

  • Œµ::Vector{Float64}: Bath energy levels.

  • g::Vector{Float64}: Bath coupling strengths.

  • sw_approximation::Bool: Whether the system should simulated in the Schrieffer-Wolff approximation.

  • œâ_A::Float64: Energy of the A site

  • Œ∑::Vector{Float64}: The damping rates.

  • œà::Float64: The asymmetry phase for the g.

NMFibreWalk.Transmission ‚Äî Type
Transmission(Œ©_B, full_params)
Transmission(Œ©_B, full_params, n)

Construct the transmission amplitude for the fourier component with frequency $œâ^0_m-œâ^0_n$ from the free spectral range of the big loop $Œ©_B$, the model parameters full_params.

source
NMFibreWalk.Transmission ‚Äî Type

A container to hold the information to construct the transmission amplitude as a function of the laser frequency.

source
NMFibreWalk.Transmission ‚Äî Method

The transmission frequency as a function of laser frequency $œâ$. If the harmonic of the transmission is zero, the stationary transmission intensity is returned. For higher harmonics the absolute value of the Fourier component is returned.

source
NMFibreWalk.WalkSolution ‚Äî Type
WalkSolution(k, params[, m_0])

A structure holding the information for the dynamic solution of the quantum walk for a specific $k$ and with optional initial position m_0. Callable with a time parameter.

source
NMFibreWalk.WalkSolution ‚Äî Method

(WalkSolution)(t)

The solution state at time $t$.

NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations ‚Äî Module

Functionality related to the discretization of the spectral density into energies and coupling strengths. See discretize_bath.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.BathDiscretization ‚Äî Type
BathDiscretization

An abstract type that defines how the bath is being discretized.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.ExponentialBathDiscretization ‚Äî Type
ExponentialBathDiscretization()

Discretize the bath with an exponential density of states $œÅ_{f} = Œî^{-1} u^{- rac{œâ}{Œî}}$.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.LinearBathDiscretization ‚Äî Type
LinearBathDiscretization(integral_method=true, simple_energies=false)

Discretize the bath with a constant density of states. The field integral_method controls whether the coupling strengths are computed using the integral of the spectral density or an approximation.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.OhmicSpectralDensity ‚Äî Type
OhmicSpectralDensity(œâ_c, J, Œ±)

An ohmic spectral density of the form $J(œâ) = J rac{Œ±+1}{œâ_c^{Œ±+1}} œâ_c^Œ±$. Calling an instance evaluates the spectral density.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.OhmicSpectralDensityIntegral ‚Äî Type
OhmicSpectralDensityIntegral(œâ_c, J, Œ±)

The antiderivate of the OhmicSpectralDensity. See its documentation for details. This struct is callable.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.OhmicSpectralDensityIntegral ‚Äî Method
OhmicSpectralDensityIntegral(J::OhmicSpectralDensity)

Instantiate an OhmicSpectralDensityIntegral from an OhmicSpectralDensity J.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.discretization_name ‚Äî Method
discretization_name(discretization)

Returns the name of the discretization.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.discretize_bath ‚Äî Function
discretize_bath(scheme, J, N[, normalize=true])

Discretize the bath using scheme according to the spectral density J into N energies and coupling strengths. Returns the energies $œµ$ and coupling strengths $g$ as vectors. The coupling strengths can be optionally normalized so that $‚àë_j g_j^2 = 1$.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.find_nodes_and_energies ‚Äî Method
find_nodes_and_energies(discretization::BathDiscretization, J, N)

Find the interval boundaries $x_k$ and the energies $œµ_k$ for the given $discretization$ method, spectral density $J$ and number of bath states $N$.

source
NMFibreWalk.BathDiscretizations.use_integral_method ‚Äî Method
use_integral_method(discretization)

Whether to use integration to obtain the coupling strengths for discretization.
